content.description: On a belay boulder on it's own in the brushy boulder section of the trail just past The Arch. Very run out from B2 to B3, leaving a very risky and blank slab with a potential ground fall. Sharp attentive belay since this moderate section of climbing is still technical and delicate and can feel desperate in the sun.
content.protection: Standard rack of 12 quick draws, expect a two bolt traditional anchor with chains or rap rings
content.location: See topo pic.  Just after the Arch and the first belay boulder in the brushy section of the trail before Swamp Monkey variations.

content.description: An area classic with a little bit of everything.  One of the best climbs at the grade!  This climb shares the first few bolts with Sea Monkeys and Drunken Monkey, but veers left and follows the enjoyable flak midway up the wall.
content.protection: Standard rack of 12 quick draws, expect traditional two bolt anchors with chains or rap rings.
content.location: See topo picture. In a brushy section of the trail just past the Arch is this group of three variations that share the same start. Leftmost variation.  Belay from boulder at the base of the wall.

content.description: Middle variation of the three monkey that shares the first few bolts with Swampy Monkey and Drunken Monkeys.  Route veers right a little above the harder Drunken Monkeys variation.
content.protection: Standard rack of 12 quick draws, expect two bolt anchors with chains or rap rings.

content.description: Right most variation with delicate slab traverse moves on the right most bolt line of the three monkey variations.  Shares the first few bolts with Sea Monkeys and Swampy Monkey.
content.protection: Standard rack of 12 quick draws, expect two bolt traditional anchor with chains or rap rings.

content.description: Just past the Arch, there is a brushy section of trail that meanders through boulders.  Swamp Monkey 5.8 is an area classic and has two slightly harder slab variations.
